title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Sizing up the top contenders for next season
content: Who will raise the national championship trophy this time next year? We break down the teams to watch.

title: Sources: Mendoza's brother to transfer from IU
content: Indiana backup quarterback Alberto Mendoza entered the NCAA transfer portal Tuesday, sources told ESPN.

title: NCAA golf champ joins LIV, forfeits Masters spot
content: Reigning NCAA men's golf champion Michael La Sasso has joined LIV Golf, forfeiting his chance to play in this year's Masters.

title: Trespassing charge vs. Vikings' Addison dropped
content: A Florida state attorney has dropped a misdemeanor trespassing charge against Vikings receiver Jordan Addison, according to court records.

title: Cignetti: IU's crown result of shift to 'new world'
content: Curt Cignetti said Indiana's national title is a "paradigm shift," one that opens the door to any program willing to invest to climb to the top of the sport.

title: Warriors' Butler suffers torn ACL, ending season
content: Warriors wing Jimmy Butler suffered a season-ending torn right ACL against the Heat on Monday, his agent told ESPN.

title: Phillies prez: Bichette joining Mets 'a gut punch'
content: Bo Bichette spurning the Phillies for the NL East rival New York Mets was akin to a gut punch for the NL East champions.

title: üëÄ NFL executives make bold predictions for 2026
content: We asked NFL executives to make bold predictions about this offseason and next season. Could we see two superstar trades?

content: With postseason losses piling up, the Bills fired coach Sean McDermott. But will it change anything? And where did things go wrong?

title: CFP takeaways: Even as a favored Goliath, Indiana's win stands alone in sports history
content: Put it next to the Miracle on Ice or NC State and Villanova. In a wild title game, here's how Indiana beat Miami.

title: Wetzel: Hoosiers delivered a national title for the everyman
content: Curt Cignetti's relentless group of discards and misfits showed what the transfer portal made possible.

title: Men's Bracketology: Don't write off Houston just yet
content: The Cougars remain national title contenders despite falling off the radar at the turn of the calendar year.

title: Women's Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: NBA midseason debate: Are the Thunder in trouble? Can the Clippers really climb in the West?
content: ESPN analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton break down the league's biggest storylines from leading challengers to surprise contenders.

title: NBA All-Star rosters: Starters, snubs and biggest questions
content: Who was the biggest surprise or snub? Which superstar duo are we most excited to see? Experts break it down.

title: USMNT World Cup big board 4.0: Pochettino's roster coming into focus
content: We're less than five months away from the USMNT's World Cup opener, and with the clock ticking down, Mauricio Pochettino's squad is coming into focus.

title: 'Everyone has someone to cheer for': Inside Fernando Mendoza's Miami homecoming
content: Indiana's quarterback has deep roots in South Florida, creating some split loyalties for the title game.

title: 'Obviously, we would have a great team': What Russian NHLers are saying about missing the Olympics
content: Russia is suspended from international competition due to the war in Ukraine, sidelining many who'd otherwise be playing.

title: Are Patriots QB Drake Maye's turnovers an issue against the Broncos?
content: The Broncos' defense is the best in the league at getting to the quarterback. How will the Patriots respond?

title: The Caleb throw, a controversial call and plenty of mistakes: Barnwell sizes up 11 divisional round plays
content: Let's sort out Caleb Williams' wild fourth-quarter TD throw, the Broncos' controversial INT, a big Seattle kickoff return TD, a C.J. Stroud pick-six and more.

title: Does bringing in a 'caretaker manager' work? Will Man United and Real Madrid improve?
content: Both Man United and Real Madrid abruptly fired their coaches without permanent replacements lined up, so "caretaker managers" will see out the season.

title: The Knicks, Nets and a crosstown friendship nearly two decades in the making
content: In 2009, Mike Brown met Jordi Fernandez and got him an internship with the Cavaliers. Seventeen years later, their relationship runs far deeper just than New York City basketball rivals.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Arizona solidifies spot, Kansas returns
content: The latest top-25 poll is out, featuring all three unbeaten teams. What's next for all 25 ranked teams?

title: Sizing up the AL Central: What each team still needs to do before spring training
content: There haven't been a lot of headline deals in this division so far, but there's still work left this winter.

title: Let's overreact to divisional round games: Pause Stroud's extension talks? Concern about Stafford?
content: Hold off on any new Stroud deals? Matthew Stafford is in a funk? No Super Bowl yet again for Buffalo? Let's make sense of every divisional round game.

title: Will Colts, Daniel Jones run it back in 2026?
content: There's mutual interest, but there's also the matter of the QB's recovery from a December torn Achilles.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal open to Gabriel Jesus exit
content: Arsenal are willing to allow Gabriel Jesus to leave, while Liverpool and Real Madrid want Micky van de Ven. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Transfer window weekly: G√ºler to Arsenal? Chelsea squad changes?
content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: 'Small details make the difference': How Jannik Sinner has changed his game since the US Open
content: At the 2025 US Open, Sinner was soundly beaten by Alcaraz. Since then, the two-time Australian Open champ has made adjustments.

title: Natalia Silva, Max Holloway can create UFC chaos immediately in 2026
content: Natalia Silva, Amanda Nunes, Max Holloway and more fighters who can derail UFC championship predictions in 2026.

title: 'No Accountability': Rahul Gandhi Blames Techie's Death On Culture Of Greed
content: Days after the death of a software engineer in Noida, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday flagged the lack of accountability and said the incident was a direct consequence of the culture of greed and disrespect to other living beings.

title: 77-Year-Old's Body Found 10 Days After Falling Into Lift Shaft In Bhopal
content: A 77-year-old man met a tragic end after he plunged down an empty lift shaft, where his body lay undiscovered for 10 days in a housing society in Bhopal, police said on Tuesday.

title: PhD Scholar, 25, Dies By Suicide At IIT Kanpur, 2nd Incident In 3 Weeks
content: A 25-year-old PhD scholar at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kanpur died by suicide after jumping from the sixth floor of a campus residential building on Tuesday afternoon, police and institute sources confirmed.

title: Rajasthan Youth Congress Dissolved, 344 Office Bearers Sacked
content: The entire state executive of the Rajasthan Youth Congress has been dissolved with immediate effect, following instructions from the party's national leadership, party sources said on Tuesday.

title: India Blocks Vehicle Transfers And Fitness Certificates For Toll Defaulters
content: The Government on Tuesday announced that it has tightened rules around toll payments on National Highways, making it clear that vehicles with pending toll dues will not be allowed to complete key registration and permit-related processes.

title: Court Ends Home Food Facility For Darshan's Partner Pavithra Gowda
content: The Karnataka High Court, on Tuesday, passed an order curtailing the home food facility granted by a lower court to Pavithra Gowda, the partner of jailed Kannada superstar Darshan, and other accused persons.

title: 'I Think Great Britain Should Be Called Simply Britain': Russian Minister
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Tuesday that Britain should no longer be called Great Britain as it was the only country in the world to officially name itself "Great".

title: UAE To Partner With Telangana To Build 'Bharat Future City' As Global Hub
content: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has agreed to partner with Telangana for the development of Bharat Future City as a top global city, the Telangana government said.

title: 'No Option Off Table': UK Considers Social Media Ban For Children
content: Britain will consider tightening rules on children's use of social media with no option "off the table," Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Tuesday, warning that they risked being pulled into "a world of endless scrolling, anxiety and comparison."

title: Man Arrested In Japan For Generating Obscene Photos Of Celebrities Using AI
content: Japanese police have arrested a man suspected of using generative AI to create more than 500,000 obscene images resembling women celebrities and selling them online.

title: Mumbai Infra Body Bags Record $96 Billion In MoUs On Day 1 At Davos
content: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) achieved a historic milestone at the World Economic Forum (WEF) Annual Summit 2026 in Davos, securing investment commitments worth USD 96 billion.

title: UK Unveils Plan To Open University Campuses In 5 Countries Including India
content: The UK has announced a new International Education Strategy aimed at expanding the global footprint of UK education and growing education exports to GBP 40 billion annually by 2030, with India identified as one of five key focus countries.

title: UP Man Kills Parents, Wife, And Daughter Over Financial Stress
content: Police on Tuesday arrested man for allegedly killing his parents, wife and daughter at their house over financial stress and domestic discord ahead of his daughter's wedding scheduled for next month here.

title: Assam's Kokrajhar Tense After Mob Kills Man Over Cattle Theft Suspicion
content: The police said that the victims were associated with a road construction project and were returning after a site inspection in a vehicle on Monday night.

title: "International Gangster": UK Leader Blasts Trump Over Greenland 'Bullying'
content: UK Member of Parliament Ed Davey, in a biting attack on US President Donald Trump, said he is acting like an "international gangster" who thinks he can "grab" what he wants by force.

title: 'Would Love To Go To The Moon, But Husband Would Kill Me': Sunita Williams To NDTV
content: NASA Astronaut Sunita Williams has always been known for her courage, her quiet confidence, and an unwavering belief in teamwork.

title: Davos Live Updates: Trump Heads To Davos With "Largest" US Delegation Yet
content: US President Donald Trump's third visit to Davos as president comes as US allies worry about his ambition to take over Greenland.

title: "Sorry, I Love You": Specially Abled Woman Dies By Suicide, Leaves Note On Palm
content: A 21-year-old specially abled woman has died by suicide in Nashik, leaving a heart-wrenching note on her palm for her parents.

title: Man Drives Luxury Car With Child On Roof In Greater Noida, Arrested
content: A video of a man driving a luxury car with a child on its roof in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida has surfaced on social media.

title: Noida Techie's Car Pulled Out 3 Days After It Fell Into Pit, May Offer Vital Clues
content: The Grand Vitara driven by 27-year-old software engineer Yuvraj Mehta, which veered off the road and landed in a water-filled construction pit amid dense fog in the early hours of Saturday, has finally been recovered.

title: 'Prefer rule of law to brutality': On Trump's tariff, Macron says won't give in to bullies
content: French President Emmanuel Macron declared Europe will not be intimidated by threats of tariffs, specifically those from US President Donald Trump regarding a potential Greenland takeover. Macron asserted that Europe will not "passively accept the law of the strongest," emphasizing a commitment to territorial sovereignty and the rule of law in a shifting global order.

title: Never a dull moment in Trump 2.0: Tariffs, airstrikes & year that kept world on edge
content: Donald Trump's second term has been a whirlwind of activity. He has commanded global attention through bold policies and a 'America First' approach.  Tariffs, military actions, and ambitious territorial proposals have reshaped international relations.  His administration has also implemented strict immigration policies.  This era marks a significant shift in global dynamics.

title: 'Kahan aim kar rahe ho?' Gambhir asks Pandya; what came next shocked everyone - watch
content: Hardik Pandya is set to return for India in the T20I series against New Zealand after recovering from injury. A net session video showed Pandya's powerful hitting, drawing humorous reactions from coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Suryakumar Yadav. Pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah also returns, bolstering the squad.

title: Trump threatens Greenland: Europe's leaders turn to Group Chat; 'Washington Group' born
content: European leaders are using a private messaging app to swiftly coordinate responses to President Trump's escalating threats, particularly concerning Greenland. This informal "Washington Group," including top officials from the UK, France, Germany, and Italy, has become vital for navigating transatlantic tensions.

title: Sunita Williams in Delhi: Nasa astronaut calls being in India 'homecoming'
content: Nasa astronaut Sunita Williams visited India, calling it a homecoming. She shared her experiences aboard the International Space Station. Williams spoke about how seeing Earth from orbit fostered a sense of global unity. India has ambitious space plans, including its own space station by 2035 and a lunar mission by 2040.

title: Sulaiman Khan Ghori exit: Engineer leaves xAI after podcast; sparks firing speculation
content: Former xAI engineer Sulaiman Khan Ghori has departed the company, sparking speculation he was "fired" for being "too candid" during a podcast interview. Ghori discussed xAI's rapid development, novel architectures like "Macro Hard," and innovative deployment strategies, including using Tesla computers for "human emulators."

title: 'If I didn‚Äôt come along, there would be no ... ': Trump takes credit for Nato's existence
content: Donald Trump claimed he single-handedly saved NATO, asserting the alliance would be defunct without him. Meanwhile, European leaders vowed an "unflinching" response to Trump's threats of tariffs over his bid to acquire Greenland, warning of a "downward spiral" in EU-US ties.

title: AR Rahman children defend him amid communal remark backlash
content: Music maestro AR Rahman sparked debate with comments on Bollywood's alleged communal shift and calling 'Chhaava' divisive. Amidst online backlash, his children, Ameen, Khatija, and Raheema, rallied in support, highlighting his global achievements and integrity. Rahman clarified his views on the film and his career trajectory.

title: Newton vs Leibniz: The calculus war classrooms never teach
content: Calculus was not born in a classroom, it was born in a fight. Isaac Newton developed fluxions in private during the plague years, while Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz published first in Acta Eruditorum and gave calculus its travelling notation. When pride entered, mathematics turned into a custody battle.

title: California billionaire tax: Thiel donates $3M to group opposing it
content: Tech titan Peter Thiel has injected $3 million into a California group opposing a proposed 5% wealth tax on billionaires. This one-time tax targets California residents with assets exceeding $1 billion. The move signals a significant early financial backing for the campaign against the "2026 Billionaire Tax Act," with other tech leaders also expressing concerns and considering relocation.

title: 'Great stupidity': After Greenland, Trump eyes Diego Garcia; why it matters to India
content: President Trump's criticism of the UK potentially returning Diego Garcia to Mauritius, a move backed by India, has escalated. This island hosts a vital US military base. India, with its own security interests in the Indian Ocean and historical ties to Mauritius, is supporting the decolonization process, offering significant aid for the archipelago's development.

title: Fernando Mendoza says his Heisman belongs to mom Elsa Mendoza; Here's why
content: Fernando Mendoza has called his mother Elsa Mendoza ‚Äúmy why‚Äù all season, but the meaning runs deeper than a soundbite. As Indiana‚Äôs Heisman-winning quarterback chased a national title, his mom‚Äôs long battle with multiple sclerosis shaped his mindset, motivation, and purpose. Here‚Äôs why Mendoza keeps pointing back to her during the biggest run of his career.

title: Shane Lowry‚Äôs net worth: The relentless rise of Ireland‚Äôs major champion
content: Shane Lowry's career is a testament to hard work, patience, and clutch performances. From an amateur Irish Open win to lifting The Open Championship trophy, he has become a reliable force on both the PGA Tour and DP World Tour. His consistent success, including recent strong showings and a record-tying 62, underscores his enduring talent and dedication.

title: John Harbaugh‚Äôs wife Ingrid turns heads during Giants‚Äô headline-making entrance
content: John Harbaugh‚Äôs arrival marks a defining shift for the New York Giants as the franchise embraces experience and stability. After nearly two decades in Baltimore, Harbaugh steps into New York with renewed purpose, supported by his family and a young, promising roster, fueling optimism about a disciplined rebuild and a competitive future.

title: Matthew Stafford‚Äôs family turns heads in Chicago with matching Rams style
content: Matthew Stafford and the Los Angeles Rams braved snowy Chicago for an NFC clash against the Bears. Despite an MVP-worthy season with 4,707 yards and 46 touchdowns, Stafford has never won the award. His wife Kelly and their four daughters cheered him on in matching custom Rams jackets, highlighting their family support as Stafford pursues his second Super Bowl in his 17th NFL season.

title: Provocateur-in-chief: How Trump's leadership differs from Obama, Reagan, or Nixon
content: That reaction itself is revealing. Trump does not see the presidency as a role shaped by inheritance, restraint, or continuity. He sees it as a personal contest, one in which dominance, visibility, and disruption are the metrics of success. To compare him with earlier presidents is therefore not just an academic exercise. It is a way of understanding how radically his leadership style departs from the American tradition.

title: Stock market crash: Nifty50, Sensex close at over 3-month lows; Rs 9.86 lakh cr wiped out
content: Stock market crash: Indian equity benchmarks, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, closed at over three-month lows after a broad selloff driven by disappointing earnings, renewed global trade risks and sustained foreign investor outflows.

title: Rohit Sharma's captaincy record that stood tall for two years ‚Äî until it was finally broken
content: India achieved a historic 317-run victory over Sri Lanka in the 3rd ODI on January 15, 2023, at Greenfield International Stadium. Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill's exceptional batting propelled India to 390/5, a total Sri Lanka failed to chase, collapsing for 73. This marked India's biggest ODI win by margin.

title: DKS' brother namedrops Rahul in CM row; Sidda puts it to 'high command‚Äô
content: Speculation over the Karnataka chief minister post continues. DK Shivakumar's brother said that Rahul Gandhi assured a decision would be made  at an "appropriate time". Shivakumar is reportedly exercising restraint for party unity. The upcoming legislative session may offer clarity. Meanwhile, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah remains open to discussions in New Delhi.

title: How Logan Paul is teaching Gen Z to hustle smart
content: Gen Z faces a job market defined by uncertainty, but social media star and entrepreneur Logan Paul shows how passion can become opportunity. From building brands to investing in rare collectibles, Paul emphasizes adaptability, calculated risk, and surrounding yourself with the right people. His advice encourages young professionals to turn interests into careers and embrace unconventional paths to success.

title: 1st T20I: Not Iyer! India captain reveals Tilak's replacement in playing XI
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said Ishan Kishan will bat at No. 3 ahead of Shreyas Iyer in the New Zealand T20 series as he is part of India‚Äôs T20 World Cup squad and a like-for-like replacement for injured Tilak Varma. Iyer will be considered at No. 5. Suryakumar stressed flexibility in batting roles and prioritised team success over individual form.

title: 'Jana Nayagan' censor row: Madras HC reserves order on CBFC process
content: Madras High Court reserved its order on the 'Jana Nayagan' censorship row after a five-hour hearing. The court examined if the CBFC followed procedures when issuing and withdrawing film certification. Arguments focused on whether producers had adequate response time and if the board could revoke an initial decision. The outcome awaits the court's decision.

title: FAFO to TACO: The terms that define Trump 2.0
content: Perhaps we should take the Kantian route and try to explain the world through terms. So here are some terms from the second Trump administration to try and decode what‚Äôs going on.

title: Delhi pollution: GRAP IV restrictions revoked; decision after slight improvement
content: Delhi-NCR's air quality has seen improvement, leading the Commission for Air Quality Management to revoke GRAP-IV restrictions just three days after their re-imposition. While the 'severe+' category triggered the ban, stages I, II, and III of GRAP remain active.  This move offers some relief from the stringent pollution control measures.

title: Maggi packets, veggies, LPG cylinders: JeM‚Äôs winter bunker in J&K; terrorists stocked up for months
content: A Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammad terror hideout, stocked for months, was busted by the army in Kishtwar's high mountains. The intense operation resulted in the supreme sacrifice of one commando and injuries to several others. Security forces continue to comb the area following the discovery.

title: Dhoom actress Rimi Sen now real estate agent in Dubai goes viral
content: Actress Rimi Sen, known for hits like 'Dhoom', has transitioned to real estate in Dubai. She praised Dubai's welcoming environment and business-friendly policies, contrasting them with India's complexities. Sen also addressed plastic surgery rumors, clarifying she's only had fillers and botox, and expressed openness to facelifts post-50.

title: Not Gukesh or Erigaisi! After Carlsen, Indian GM confirmed for Norway Chess
content: Indian GM R Praggnanandhaa has confirmed his third appearance at Norway Chess, becoming the second announced participant after Magnus Carlsen. The 2026 Candidates qualifier and world No. 4 previously won the event in 2022 and defeated Carlsen in 2024. Organisers praised his consistency and ambition, while hopes remain for D Gukesh and Arjun Erigaisi to join the field.

title: What Musk, Altman, Brin agree on: Students should pay attention to computer science & maths
content: Elon Musk, Sam Altman and Sergey Brin are not selling students the newest AI tool or coding shortcut. Their advice is older, harder and suddenly urgent: go back to maths and core computer science. As AI makes routine coding and formula work cheap, what rises in value is judgment ‚Äî the ability to reason, build systems, and spot when an answer is polished nonsense.

title: Crash on 90-degree road: How civic neglect killed techie in 'planned' Noida
content: The heartbreaking drowning of a software engineer in an overflown, decade-old trench underscores a serious lapse in stormwater management over the years. Although funding and blueprints were set in 2015 to build a vital water-diverting regulator for the Hindon River, this life-saving project has yet to materialize, leading to devastating flooding that has affected numerous housing developments.

title: China criticises US tariffs at World Economic Forum; promises wider opening of economy
content: China used its platform at the World Economic Forum in Davos to warn that trade and tariff wars help no one and risk deepening global economic tensions. Vice-Premier He Lifeng called for cooperation over isolation, saying China would open its economy further and focus on boosting domestic demand, even as global trade disputes escalate under US President Donald Trump‚Äôs expanded tariff policies.

title: Warning! 'Ball daal apna chup chap aur peeche ja': Rohit Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav
content: Former captain Rohit Sharma offered advice to spinner Kuldeep Yadav for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Sharma suggested Yadav focus on his bowling and refrain from frequent appeals. This comes as the team considers selection between Yadav and Varun Chakaravarthy. Yadav is part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup.

title: Ranji Trophy: Rahul to play for Karnataka; NKR confirms availability for Andhra
content: KL Rahul will return to Ranji Trophy action for Karnataka against Punjab from January 29, while Nitish Kumar Reddy has confirmed availability for Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs remaining group games. Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja are also set for domestic outings. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant is likely to miss the second leg of the tournament due to injury and he may head to the CoE in coming days.

title: The new H-1B map: Where America pays global talent and where it quietly doesn‚Äôt
content: A year after Donald Trump‚Äôs return to office, the H-1B visa is no longer a uniform national pathway. Using US Department of Labor data analysed by Manifest Law, this story maps how sharply H-1B wages now diverge by city‚Äîturning geography into destiny, reshaping leverage for workers, and creating unequal outcomes, especially for Indian professionals navigating America‚Äôs talent economy.

title: 'I don't care about Nobel Prize': Trump breaks silence on letter to Norway PM
content: President Trump declared he no longer cares about the Nobel Prize after not receiving it, despite previously campaigning for it. He also stated he no longer feels obligated to "think purely of Peace" regarding Greenland, questioning Denmark's ownership and demanding NATO support for U.S. control of the territory.

title: Stock market crash: Nifty50 ends below 25,250; BSE Sensex down over 1,000 points - top reasons
content: Stock market crash today: Indian stock markets, Nifty50 and Sensex, experienced a significant crash today, driven by a sharp selloff in technology stocks amidst uneven earnings and global trade uncertainties. Foreign investors continued their selling spree, while gold and silver prices surged, signaling a clear shift towards risk aversion among investors seeking safe havens.

title: Noida techie death: Trucker rammed into same boundary wall 10 days ago; yet no repair
content: A 27-year-old software engineer tragically drowned after his SUV plunged into a deep, water-filled pit in Noida's Sector 150. The same damaged wall had been hit by a truck just days prior. Despite repeated warnings and a prior incident, no repairs were made, sparking outrage and administrative action.

title: India's trailblazer: From Sania mix-ups to sporting immortality - farewell Nehwal
content: Indian badminton icon Saina Nehwal has officially retired at 35, concluding a storied career marked by numerous firsts.  She became the first Indian woman to win an Olympic medal in badminton, achieve World No. 1 ranking, and reach the BWF World Championship final.  Her grit popularised the sport, inspiring a generation.

title: Palghar long march: Won‚Äôt go home without land ownership, say protesters
content: Their demands include land ownership under Forest Rights Act, removal of smart meters, and cancellation of the Vadhavan project in Dahanu, a coastal region of Palghar.

title: India withdraws families, dependents of diplomats and officials from all missions in Bangladesh
content: A source says the evacuation was carried out ‚Äúgiven the security situation, as a precautionary measure‚Äù

title: KDRB moves SC against HC annulment of its power of appointment to Guruvayur Devaswom
content: The KDRB has submitted that its functions were limited to affairs of recruitment and did not intervene in the religious duties concerning temples

title: Mobs vandalise BDO offices as violent protests against SIR continue in West Bengal
content: Protests erupt a day after SC observation that SIR should be transparent, not cause inconvenience; BJP, TMC supporters clash over Form 7 submissions

title: SIR order was legislative, approach liberal, EC tells Supreme Court
content: Countering attacks that the SIR did not have any statutory backing and the poll panel invented the procedure out of ‚Äúthin air‚Äù, the EC said Article 324 provided it with the freedom to prepare the electoral roll

title: Draft Seeds Bill promotes private monopoly: Kisan Sabha
content: The priority should have been to ensure affordable quality seeds, and planting material with an emphasis on price control, the Kisan Sabha said

title: High-level M.P. government panel to probe Indore water tragedy
content: The committee will conduct a detailed review of the events surrounding contaminated water supply in Indore city, and determine the accountability of staff responsible for the incident

title: Modi systematically strangling protections for poor, diverting resources: Rahul Gandhi
content: At an MGNREGA choupal in his constituency, the LoP accuses the BJP of undermining the scheme, diverting funds meant for workers, women, and the poor to big industrialists like Adani and Ambani.

title: Vinod Tawde to be BJP‚Äôs poll in-charge for Kerala, Ram Madhav for Bengaluru civic election
content: BJP president Nitin Nabin makes his first organisational appointments on the day he took charge as the party‚Äôs chief; Mr. Tawde has also been given charge of overseeing election of a new mayor for Chandigarh

title: SC sets aside HC order for CBI probe into Ambience Mall project
content: Top court says High Court direction was ex facie erroneous; clarifies other proceedings will continue

title: Congress flags reports of journalists being summoned in J&K over ‚Äòroutine reporting‚Äô
content: AICC in-charge for Jammu and Kashmir, Syed Naseer Hussain, said a democratic society could not function if ‚Äúthe basic act of asking questions is treated as an act of defiance‚Äù.  Congress flags reports of journalists being summoned in J&K over ‚Äúroutine reporting‚Äù

title: Fisheries Ministry to meet envoys to find new seafood export markets
content: Ambassadors and High Commissioners from about 80 countries to attend a ‚ÄúFisheries Round Table‚Äù organised by the  Ministry

title: Contest for name, logo for new liquor brand: HC issues notice to govt., Bevco
content: The Kerala Catholic Bishops‚Äô Council had criticised the naming contest, describing it as a form of surrogate advertising for liquor and warning that it could send a wrong message to society

title: ‚ÄòSerious‚Äô about dog feeder liability, says SC as animal groups warn of ‚Äòunfortunate‚Äô outcomes
content: The three-judge Bench makes the observation after advocate Prashant Bhushan, appearing for an intervener, submits that he was under the impression that the Bench‚Äôs earlier remark on fixing accountability on dog feeders was made ‚Äòsarcastically‚Äô and could therefore be ‚Äòmisinterpreted‚Äô

title: Five arrested in Rajasthan over large-scale irregularities in exam held by Staff Selection Board
content: The accused, including the then Deputy Director and system programmer of the State Staff Selection Board, allegedly manipulated the OMR sheets in the exams; 3,212 posts were advertised under the exams, for which over 9.40 lakh candidates had applied

title: Kerala SIR: KPCC seeks to publish names on ‚Äòlogical discrepancy‚Äô list
content: MLA Mathew Kuzhalnadan hands over a letter to Chief Electoral Officer (Kerala) Rathan U. Kelkar in this regard

title: A.P. CM Naidu pushes for AI and startup growth initiatives at Davos meet
content: Naidu meets global technology leaders and outlines vision to transform Andhra Pradesh as a knowledge economy and innovation-driven State

title: KSRTC commuters to get real-time bus tracking through VTMS soon
content: The Central Control Station, which will be located at the Mysuru Road Satellite Bus Station in Bengaluru, will function as the nerve centre of the VTMS

title: It is the duty of all Left, democratic forces to hold high the flag of democracy: CPI (M) general secretary M A Baby
content: The false narratives of the fascist RSS backed forces need to be countered and relentless efforts be made to strengthen independent Left organisations to jointly combat the communal and fascist forces, Mr. Baby said

title: FCV tobacco farmers urge Centre to review hike in cigarette tax
content: The ‚Äòsudden tax shock‚Äô is likely to contract demand for legal cigarettes, leading to lower auction prices of tobacco, weak buyer participation, unsold stocks and growing distress among farmers, says Federation of All India Farmers‚Äô Associations

title: Ex-CAPF officials file contempt plea against Home Secretary for not implementing Supreme Court order
content: The top couordered progressive reduction of the IPS deputation in CAPFs up to the level of IGs in the next two years and sought a time-bound review of cadre and service rules in six months

title: Verdict on Unnikrishnan Potti‚Äôs bail plea today
content: He is the prime accused in a case involving the theft of gold from the Dwarapalaka sculptures at the Sabarimala temple

title: British diplomat evinces interest in Amaravati development
content: Deputy High Commissioner Gareth Wynn Owen also discusses with MA&UD Minister Narayana the  possibilities for collaboration in urban planning, infrastructure development and investment

title: Health institutions should comply with provisions of Clinical Establishments Act, says government

content: On January 3, a speeding jeep had rammed the motorcycle on which the couple was travelling; relatives allege foul play.

title: Second phase development of Vizhinjam port to be completed in 2028, says Port Minister
content: The second phase of expansion, which was scheduled for completion in 2045, will involve an investment of approximately ‚Çπ10,000 crore.

title: ACB Court‚Äôs refusal to provide verdict copies pertaining to Naidu challenged in High Court
content: Noting that third parties are ordinarily not entitled to obtain the copies, the High Court questions the benefit the petitioner seeks from obtaining the same, and adjourns the matter to February 3

title: Treat hate speech as constitutional tort, not mere policing issue, petitioners urge Supreme Court
content: The top court reserved its order on a batch of petitions highlighting the rise of hate speech and seeking directions to regulate religious gatherings that promote such practices

title: The AFC North: 1 coach, 2 (?) starting QBs, many questions
content: new coach will have to cultivate a working relationship with lamar Jackson . owner Steve Bisciotti learned that Mike Tomlin had stepped down as the Pittsburgh Steelers ' head coach . this has become one of the most surprising offseasons in the AFC North because of the uncharacteristic turnover .

title: Blue Monday: Why Marc Gu√©hi joining Man City leaves Liverpool in a mess
content: the third Monday of January has been widely dubbed "Blue Monday" for more than two decades . skeptics would argue the occasion is nothing more than a marketing ploy . liverpool fans will certainly have felt glum on Monday afternoon after marc Gu√©hi's transfer .

title: Tyrese Maxey signs deal with New Balance for first signature shoe
content: Tyrese Maxey shows off the range on 3-point shot (0:19) Tyrese Maxey  is getting a signature shoe. On Tuesday, both Maxey and New Balance told ESPN's Shams Charania that the two sides are in agreement on a new deal which includes a signature shoe line. The new kicks are expected to debut later in 2026. This is the first signature shoe for the  Philadelphia 76ers  guard. He joins  Kawhi Leonard ,  Cameron Brink  and  Jamal Murray  as other hoops stars who've signed with New Balance. This is the latest good news this week for Maxey, who was named to his second All-Star team and  first as a starter  on Monday. He's currently third in the league in points per game, averaging 30.2.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the top six teams remain the same . just two of the Huskies' 13 remaining regular-season opponents are ranked: Notre Dame and Tennessee .

title: Which injuries will have the biggest impact on the Olympic hockey tournament?
content: leo Carlsson is out three to five weeks with a thigh injury . the 21-year-old has 38 points through 29 games this season . he has been struggling recently to the tune of six points in 15 games .

title: Can Kenneth Walker III carry Seahawks to Super Bowl after Zach Charbonnet's injury?
content: Seahawks running back Zach Charbonnet missed the rest of the playoffs with a knee injury . the seahawks might not be hosting the game at Lumen Field as the conference's top seed . a successful try tied the score at 30-30 .

title: Indiana -- yes, Indiana! -- is the national champ! How Curt Cignetti and the Hoosiers did it
content: a year ago, it felt hard to believe the losingest program in FBS history would have much staying power . critics ripped their schedule, called them a fluke, debated whether they even deserved to make the college football Playoff . they should leave the real football to the real blue bloods . the man simply does not lose .

title: Who's getting into the Hall of Fame? Everything you need to know on ballot reveal day

title: Nitin Nabin takes charge as BJP prez: What's at stake for PM Modi's 'boss'
